channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Enhancing Hyper-To-Real Space Projections Through Euclidean Norm Meta-Heuristic Optimization
item.description: The continuous computational power growth in the last decades has made solving several optimization problems significant to humankind a tractable task; however, tackling some of them remains a challenge due to the overwhelming amount of candidate solutions to be evaluated, even by using sophisticated algorithms.

item.title: Sport Task: Fine Grained Action Detection and Classification of Table Tennis Strokes from Videos for MediaEval 2022
item.description: Since 2021, the task also provides a stroke detection challenge from unannotated, untrimmed videos.

item.title: IM-IAD: Industrial Image Anomaly Detection Benchmark in Manufacturing
item.description: We realize that the lack of actual IM settings most probably hinders the development and usage of these methods in real-world applications.

item.title: ZhichunRoad at Amazon KDD Cup 2022: MultiTask Pre-Training for E-Commerce Product Search
item.description: In this paper, we propose a robust multilingual model to improve the quality of search results.

item.title: What Makes Good Examples for Visual In-Context Learning?
item.description: To overcome the problem, we propose a prompt retrieval framework to automate the selection of in-context examples.

item.title: NP-Match: Towards a New Probabilistic Model for Semi-Supervised Learning
item.description: In this work, we adjust neural processes (NPs) to the semi-supervised image classification task, resulting in a new method named NP-Match.

item.title: The Flan Collection: Designing Data and Methods for Effective Instruction Tuning
item.description: We study the design decisions of publicly available instruction tuning methods, and break down the development of Flan 2022 (Chung et al., 2022).

item.title: Attend-and-Excite: Attention-Based Semantic Guidance for Text-to-Image Diffusion Models
item.description: Recent text-to-image generative models have demonstrated an unparalleled ability to generate diverse and creative imagery guided by a target text prompt.

item.title: A Counterfactual Collaborative Session-based Recommender System
item.description: Next, COCO-SBRS adopts counterfactual inference to recommend items based on the outputs of the pre-trained recommendation model considering the causalities to alleviate the data sparsity problem.

item.title: Few-Shot Image-to-Semantics Translation for Policy Transfer in Reinforcement Learning
item.description: We investigate policy transfer using image-to-semantics translation to mitigate learning difficulties in vision-based robotics control agents.

item.title: PADL: Language-Directed Physics-Based Character Control
item.description: In this work, we present PADL, which leverages recent innovations in NLP in order to take steps towards developing language-directed controllers for physics-based character animation.

item.title: From Semi-supervised to Omni-supervised Room Layout Estimation Using Point Clouds
item.description: But adapting this scheme to the state-of-the-art (SOTA) solution for PC-based layout estimation is not straightforward.

item.title: Faithful Chain-of-Thought Reasoning
item.description: Together with self-consistency decoding, we achieve new state-of-the-art few-shot performance on 7 out of the 10 datasets, showing a strong synergy between faithfulness and accuracy.

item.title: Superhuman Fairness
item.description: The fairness of machine learning-based decisions has become an increasingly important focus in the design of supervised machine learning methods.

item.title: LogAI: A Library for Log Analytics and Intelligence
item.description: In order to enable users to perform multiple types of AI-based log analysis tasks in a uniform manner, we introduce LogAI (https://github. com/salesforce/logai), a one-stop open source library for log analytics and intelligence.

item.title: Neural Target Speech Extraction: An Overview
item.description: Humans can listen to a target speaker even in challenging acoustic conditions that have noise, reverberation, and interfering speakers.

item.title: Image Shortcut Squeezing: Countering Perturbative Availability Poisons with Compression
item.description: Perturbative availability poisoning (PAP) adds small changes to images to prevent their use for model training.

item.title: CaraNet: Context Axial Reverse Attention Network for Segmentation of Small Medical Objects
item.description: This paper proposes a Context Axial Reverse Attention Network (CaraNet) to improve the segmentation performance on small objects compared with several recent state-of-the-art models.

item.title: Learning, Fast and Slow: A Goal-Directed Memory-Based Approach for Dynamic Environments
item.description: To address these challenges, we do the following: i) Instead of a neural network, we do model-based planning using a parallel memory retrieval system (which we term the slow mechanism); ii) Instead of learning state values, we guide the agent's actions using goal-directed exploration, by using a neural network to choose the next action given the current state and the goal state (which we term the fast mechanism).

item.title: Differentially Private Distributed Bayesian Linear Regression with MCMC
item.description: We develop a novel generative statistical model for privately shared statistics, which exploits a useful distributional relation between the summary statistics of linear regression.

item.title: A Survey and Benchmark of Automatic Surface Reconstruction from Point Clouds
item.description: We survey and benchmark traditional and novel learning-based algorithms that address the problem of surface reconstruction from point clouds.

item.title: NoiseTransfer: Image Noise Generation with Contrastive Embeddings
item.description: Although several real-world noisy datasets have been presented, the number of train datasets (i. e., pairs of clean and real noisy images) is limited, and acquiring more real noise datasets is laborious and expensive.

item.title: CRC-RL: A Novel Visual Feature Representation Architecture for Unsupervised Reinforcement Learning
item.description: This paper addresses the problem of visual feature representation learning with an aim to improve the performance of end-to-end reinforcement learning (RL) models.

item.title: Tricking AI chips into Simulating the Human Brain: A Detailed Performance Analysis
item.description: Challenging the Nvidia monopoly, dedicated AI-accelerator chips have begun emerging for tackling the computational challenge that the inference and, especially, the training of modern deep neural networks (DNNs) poses to modern computers.

item.title: Execution-based Code Generation using Deep Reinforcement Learning
item.description: The utilization of programming language (PL) models, pretrained on large-scale code corpora, as a means of automating software engineering processes has demonstrated considerable potential in streamlining various code generation tasks such as code completion, code translation, and program synthesis.

item.title: Deep learning-based lung segmentation and automatic regional template in chest X-ray images for pediatric tuberculosis
item.description: In clinical practice, experienced physicians assess TB by examining chest X-rays (CXR).

item.title: Multicalibration as Boosting for Regression
item.description: Using this characterization, we give an exceedingly simple algorithm that can be analyzed both as a boosting algorithm for regression and as a multicalibration algorithm for a class H that makes use only of a standard squared error regression oracle for H. We give a weak learning assumption on H that ensures convergence to Bayes optimality without the need to make any realizability assumptions -- giving us an agnostic boosting algorithm for regression.

item.title: Anomaly Segmentation for High-Resolution Remote Sensing Images Based on Pixel Descriptors
item.description: Anomaly segmentation in high spatial resolution (HSR) remote sensing imagery is aimed at segmenting anomaly patterns of the earth deviating from normal patterns, which plays an important role in various Earth vision applications.

item.title: Mono-STAR: Mono-camera Scene-level Tracking and Reconstruction
item.description: We present Mono-STAR, the first real-time 3D reconstruction system that simultaneously supports semantic fusion, fast motion tracking, non-rigid object deformation, and topological change under a unified framework.

item.title: Streaming Anomaly Detection
item.description: We then extend the count-min sketch to a Higher-Order sketch to capture complex relations in graph data, and to reduce detecting suspicious dense subgraph problem to finding a dense submatrix in constant time.

item.title: Protein Representation Learning via Knowledge Enhanced Primary Structure Modeling
item.description: Protein representation learning has primarily benefited from the remarkable development of language models (LMs).

item.title: Audio-Visual Segmentation with Semantics
item.description: To deal with these problems, we propose a new baseline method that uses a temporal pixel-wise audio-visual interaction module to inject audio semantics as guidance for the visual segmentation process.

item.title: LongEval: Guidelines for Human Evaluation of Faithfulness in Long-form Summarization
item.description: Motivated by our survey, we present LongEval, a set of guidelines for human evaluation of faithfulness in long-form summaries that addresses the following challenges: (1) How can we achieve high inter-annotator agreement on faithfulness scores?

item.title: SSR-TA: Sequence to Sequence based expert recurrent recommendation for ticket automation
item.description: The recurrent recommendation network recommends the appropriate expert based on the assumption that the previous expert in the recommendation sequence cannot solve the expert.

item.title: FedFA: Federated Feature Augmentation
item.description: To reach this goal, we propose FedFA to tackle federated learning from a distinct perspective of federated feature augmentation.

item.title: TrFedDis: Trusted Federated Disentangling Network for Non-IID Domain Feature
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, our proposed TrFedDis is the first work to develop an FL approach based on evidential uncertainty combined with feature disentangling, which enhances the performance and reliability of FL in non-IID domain features.

item.title: GALIP: Generative Adversarial CLIPs for Text-to-Image Synthesis
item.description: The complex scene understanding ability of CLIP enables the discriminator to accurately assess the image quality.

item.title: Optimal Decision Tree Policies for Markov Decision Processes
item.description: While there is generally a trade-off between the performance and interpretability of machine learning models, we find that OMDTs limited to a depth of 3 often perform close to the optimal limit.

item.title: How Far Can It Go?: On Intrinsic Gender Bias Mitigation for Text Classification
item.description: Considering that the end use of these language models is for downstream tasks like text classification, it is important to understand how these intrinsic bias mitigation strategies actually translate to fairness in downstream tasks and the extent of this.

item.title: Evaluating Neuron Interpretation Methods of NLP Models
item.description: In this work, we propose an evaluation framework that measures the compatibility of a neuron analysis method with other methods.

item.title: The Secret of Metaphor on Expressing Stronger Emotion
item.description: Metaphors are proven to have stronger emotional impact than literal expressions.

item.title: Regularized Weight Aggregation in Networked Federated Learning for Glioblastoma Segmentation
item.description: We introduce a practical and cost-efficient method for regularized weight aggregation and propose a laborsaving technique to select collaborators per round.

item.title: Can Persistent Homology provide an efficient alternative for Evaluation of Knowledge Graph Completion Methods?
item.description: $\mathcal{KP}$ addresses this by representing the topology of the KG completion methods through the lens of topological data analysis, concretely using persistent homology.

item.title: Advancing Radiograph Representation Learning with Masked Record Modeling
item.description: Modern studies in radiograph representation learning rely on either self-supervision to encode invariant semantics or associated radiology reports to incorporate medical expertise, while the complementarity between them is barely noticed.

item.title: Edge-guided Multi-domain RGB-to-TIR image Translation for Training Vision Tasks with Challenging Labels
item.description: The insufficient number of annotated thermal infrared (TIR) image datasets not only hinders TIR image-based deep learning networks to have comparable performances to that of RGB but it also limits the supervised learning of TIR image-based tasks with challenging labels.

item.title: Quantifying Context Mixing in Transformers
item.description: Self-attention weights and their transformed variants have been the main source of information for analyzing token-to-token interactions in Transformer-based models.

item.title: SeaFormer: Squeeze-enhanced Axial Transformer for Mobile Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Coupled with a light segmentation head, we achieve the best trade-off between segmentation accuracy and latency on the ARM-based mobile devices on the ADE20K and Cityscapes datasets.

item.title: Image Contrast Enhancement using Fuzzy Technique with Parameter Determination using Metaheuristics
item.description: We have used a fuzzy system as our transformation function.

item.title: Contrastive Meta-Learning for Partially Observable Few-Shot Learning
item.description: We evaluate our approach on an adaptation of a comprehensive few-shot learning benchmark, Meta-Dataset, and demonstrate the benefits of POEM over other meta-learning methods at representation learning from partial observations.

item.title: On the Efficacy of Metrics to Describe Adversarial Attacks
item.description: To test defenses, diverse adversarial attacks are crafted, that are usually described in terms of their evading capability and the L0, L1, L2, and Linf norms.
